thread.title: Forget Storm Doris: Atlantic surge to bring 12 DAYS of storm hell to UK from this weekend
thread.title_full: Forget Storm Doris: Atlantic surge to bring 12 DAYS of storm hell to UK from this weekend

title: Forget Storm Doris: Atlantic surge to bring 12 DAYS of storm hell to UK from this weekend
text:
“Hot on the heels of Doris comes Saturday’s 50mph gusts in the North-West, with high rain totals.” Met Office forecaster Mark Wilson 
Met Office forecaster Mark Wilson said: “Doris looks like the most severe storm of winter so far." 
“Driving conditions look treacherous for parts, with up to 30cm of snow drifting in strong winds. 
“Any high ground receiving the heavy snow will risk drifts. 
“Hot on the heels of Doris comes Saturday’s 50mph gusts in the North-West, with high rain totals. 
“It stays windy on Monday, risking snow to lower levels further north. 
“In the period to March 8, further weather systems will affect the UK from the Atlantic. 
“All areas are likely to turn colder by midweek, with the changeable Atlantic influence likely into March, with strong winds and rain at times, falling as snow further north.” 
VENTUSKY CARNAGE: Storm Doris caused mayhem across the UK today Travel CHAOS as Storm Doris batters UK Thursday, 23rd February 2017 Storm Doris has battered the UK with winds of up to 90mph, causing travel chaos across the country 1 / 10 Getty Images Men recover an overturned gritting lorry near Balfron Station 
The Weather Outlook forecaster Brian Gaze said: “Thursday was atrocious for large parts of the UK. 
“Saturday has severe gales possible in the North-West, with wet and windy weather on Sunday afternoon and next week unsettled with showers or longer periods of rain or all regions. 
“Snow is possible perhaps down to low levels in the North.” Related articles
